org.ohs1.winter2013

Class BuiltInTester

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ohs1.winter2013.BuiltInTester

  • public class BuiltInTester
extends java.lang.Object
    The BuiltInTester API is intended for testing the logic of methods from inside the code and printing out meaningful and readable output. If not enabled, it leaves as little of a footprint as possible by using a sudo-singleton structure.

    The BuiltInTester class is a container for the BuiltInTester instance. The methods of the instance are all called through static methods with similar names so that the instance of the BuiltInTester class is never used if the testing system is not enabled.

    The BuiltInTester system is enabled by calling the enable(String,String) and passing to it the name of the program and the name of the output file as parameters. The output file name will be the parameter and three numbers appended to it such that they are sequential. The program name is used as the directory in which the files are stored.

    Version:
    1.4, 30 Jan 2014
    Author:
    Kostyantyn Proskuryakov, Ian Johnson

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public static void enable(java.lang.String programName,
          java.lang.String outputFileName)
        Enables the BuiltInTester API. All BuiltInTester methods after the enable point can do their tasks. Should be placed at the beginning of execution and commented out if testing is not required.
        Parameters:
        programName - Directory name of the output files.
        outputFileName - Name of the output files.

      • expecting

        public static void expecting(java.lang.String logMessage,
             java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Sets the expectation that if a certain set of parameters are the wanted values, the log message specified will be the one that is obtained from log(String). This method should be peppered at the beginning of any method that needs logic testing. Several should be created with different parameters and their associated expected messages to provide as much logic testing as possible.
        Parameters:
        logMessage - The expected message given the parameters.
        parameters - A reference to the parameter itself followed by the value of the parameter to expect the log message if the reference equals the value.

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String message)
        Should be used right before any return statement. The logs will show the message when the method returns.
        Parameters:
        message - The message that gets logged upon return by that specific return statement.

      • outputLog

        public static void outputLog()
        Should be called at the very end of execution. Creates the output log as an html page under the project directory in the folder designated by programName and the filename designated by outputFileName with three digits at the end that increment by 1 with every new output log created. File directory structure is cross-platform.

        Example output log files:
        Test_Program\output000.html
        Test_Program\output001.html
        Test_Program\output002.html
